channel.title: Setting a cookie with Javascript
channel.description: I just started picking up javascript a few days ago and I need help of setting a cookie called height with the value a variable called myHeight and the expiration a minute. Can any one tell me how to do this? I'm used to PHP.

item.title: Setting a cookie with Javascript
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

is login_container used in a class tag, or in an id tag?
if it’s used in a class tag, you have to use .login_container, if you use it in an ID, you need to use #login_container

Read full topic

w3schools usually isnt the best. Go through all the results until you understand it. Google has every answer to every question, and is 10x faster than asking if you know how to use it. http://thatoneserver.no-ip.org/xp/ ive never used javascript either until then… magic of google.
[/quote]

See I tried that already, I’m not a complete idiot. I went through like 5 pages and NONE of them explained what to put in set cookie, except set_cookie(c_name, value, expdate), but it didn’t explain whether or not they should be replaced with a variable or a string or anything.[/quote]
there is no function set_cookie…

anyway i fixed it for u read my post

item.title: Setting a cookie with Javascript
item.dc:creator: @Bang_Train Bang Train
item.description:
@Bang_Train wrote:

[s]well

this is causing issues with firefox

since u have no function body[/s]

fixed:

your size() function was never getting called:

replace

with

and

set_cookie ( "height", myHeight );
var exdate=new Date();

exdate.setDate(exdate.getDate()+1);
document.cookie=“height=” +escape(myHeight)+
((expiredays==null) ? “” : “;expires=”+exdate.toGMTString());

with (note the getDate() + 1 is 1 day later)

var exdate=new Date();
exdate.setDate(exdate.getDate()+1);
document.cookie=“height=” +escape(myHeight)+";expires="+exdate.toGMTString();

Read full topic

item.title: Setting a cookie with Javascript
item.dc:creator: @Bang_Train Bang Train
item.description:
@Bang_Train wrote:

get viewcookie cs for firefox and see if the cookie is being created and contains the right data

and why 174?
and got a link?

edit:

<?php header('content-type:text/css'); $fakeheight = $_COOKIE['height']; $realheight = $fakeheight - $number; $number = '174'; ?>

you set the number AFTER you are subtracting it…and its a string… why is it a string?

<?php header('content-type:text/css'); $fakeheight = $_COOKIE['height']; $number = 174; $realheight = $fakeheight - $number; ?>

Read full topic

item.title: Setting a cookie with Javascript
item.dc:creator: @RXVL RXVL
item.description:
@RXVL wrote:

Ok, maybe I should explain what I’m doing.

I wrote a script that preloads images and gets the height of the browser window, then it writes the value of myHeight (the height variable) to a cookie. Then the page redirects to a php page where the css.php file (yes, it’s a .php css file) loads the cookie and subtracts 174 from it, then it echos it to the height: property.

Heres the load the height function:

<script language="JavaScript1.1"> function Size() { var myHeight = 0; if (typeof (window.innerWidth) == 'number') { //Non-IE myHeight = window.innerHeight; } else if (document.documentElement && document.documentElement.clientHeight) { //IE 6+ in 'standards compliant mode' myHeight = document.documentElement.clientHeight; } else if (document.body && document.body.clientHeight) { myHeight = document.body.clientHeight; } set_cookie ( "height", myHeight ); } </script>

And heres the css.php file:

[code]<?php
header(‘content-type:text/css’);
$fakeheight = $_COOKIE[‘height’];
$realheight = $fakeheight - $number;
$number = ‘174’;
?>

#login_container {
position: absolute;
z-index: 0;
height: <?=$realheight?>;
width: 599px;
margin: -207px auto 0 auto;
padding: 0;
background-image: url(…/img/login_container.gif);
background-position: top center;
background-repeat: repeat-y;
}[/code]

So, does anyone have a clue whats going wrong?

Read full topic
